title: Enchanted lyre

properties.name: description
properties.value: The enchanted lyre is acquired in The Fremennik Trials quest. It is used in the quest to perform in the longhall to get Olaf the Bard's vote for the player to become a Fremennik. The lyre can be made by using an axe to cut a branch from the swaying tree east of Rellekka, and then using a knife on the branch to obtain an unstrung lyre, then attaching spun golden fleece. This part needs 25 Fletching. Alternatively, players may receive one as a drop from Lanzig, Borrokar or Freidir in their huts in the south-eastern area of the village.

SMW Subobject for UnchargedExamine: A musical instrument that I can magically play.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Enchanted lyreUses infobox: ItemImage: File:Enchanted lyre.pngWeight: 1.814Value: 1Version anchor: UnchargedRelease date: 2 November 2004Item ID: 3690

The enchanted lyre is acquired in The Fremennik Trials quest. It is used in the quest to perform in the longhall to get Olaf the Bard's vote for the player to become a Fremennik. The lyre can be made by using an axe to cut a branch from the swaying tree east of Rellekka, and then using a knife on the branch to obtain an unstrung lyre, then attaching spun golden fleece. This part needs 25 Fletching. Alternatively, players may receive one as a drop from Lanzig, Borrokar or Freidir in their huts in the south-eastern area of the village.

A player plays the lyre to teleport to the Fremennik Province.

After the quest, the player can enchant their normal lyre into an enchanted lyre by charging it with Fossegrimen to be used as a teleport to Rellekka. When the hard Fremennik Diary is completed, the enchanted lyre can also teleport to Waterbirth Island, and gains the ability to teleport to Jatizso and Neitiznot after completion of the elite Fremennik Diary.

While equipped, the colour of the lyre's middle section is the same as the player's shoe colour.

Combat styles[edit | edit source]

Category: UnarmedCombat StyleStyle typeWeapon StyleExperienceInvisible Boost
PunchCrushAccurateAttack and Hitpoints+3 Attack
KickCrushAggressiveStrength and Hitpoints+3 Strength
BlockCrushDefensiveDefence and Hitpoints+3 Defence

Charging[edit | edit source]

A player has their lyre enchanted by Fossegrimen.

The lyre is enchanted by offering raw large fish to Fossegrimen's altar south-west of Rellekka. Players may offer a raw shark, raw manta ray, or raw sea turtle to receive two, three, or four charges, respectively. If players equip a ring of charos (a), they can give Fossegrimen a raw bass and explain that it is really a small shark, and she will recharge the lyre with two charges. Upon expending the last charge, the lyre will revert to its unenchanted form. Players can only charge an unenchanted lyre.

When the easy Fremennik Diary is completed, Fossegrimen will give an extra charge in addition to the offering given.

Offering Number of Teleports With Easy Diary Bonus
Raw shark 2 (384.5 per charge) 3 (256.33 per charge)
Raw bass[1] 2 (9 per charge) 3 (6 per charge)
Raw manta ray 3 (436 per charge) 4 (327 per charge)
Raw sea turtle 4 (203.5 per charge) 5 (162.8 per charge)
  1. ^ Requires the ring of charos (a) to be equipped.

Imbuing[edit | edit source]

After completion of The Fremennik Trials, players can imbue their lyre into an enchanted lyre(i), which contains infinite charges, by offering Fossegrimen a one-off offering of 1,000 raw sharks, raw bass, raw manta rays and raw sea turtles, costing 2,909,000. Fossegrimen will accept both noted and un-noted offerings, and they can be given in increments; she will inform players of the remaining amount required to imbue the lyre.

The offering cost will drop by 200 raw fish of each type for each tier of the Fremennik Diary completed. However, she will not return any fish once a higher tier of the diary has been completed.

If lost, it can be re-obtained by going to the Fossegrimen and clicking "Summon" on the altar with a Lyre in inventory. Players do not have to pay the 1,000 of each fish cost if they have already paid it once before.

Diary Tier Raw fish Total GE cost
None 1000 2,909,000
Easy 800 2,327,200
Medium 600 1,745,400
Hard 400 1,163,600
Elite 200 581,800

Teleportation options[edit | edit source]

Destination Map
Rellekka[1]
Waterbirth Island[2]
Jatizso[3]
Neitiznot[4]
  1. ^ Requires charging with Fossegrimen
  2. ^ Requires completion of the hard Fremennik Diary
  3. ^ Requires completion of the elite Fremennik Diary
  4. ^ Requires completion of the elite Fremennik Diary

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
30 May 2019
(update | poll)

After completing The Fremennik Trials, you may now enchant your Lyre from Fossegrimen for permanent lyre teleports for 1,000 Raw Sea Turtles, Raw Manta Rays, Raw Sharks and Raw Bass. This drops by 200 for each Fremennik diary completed, however, she will not return any fish once you've completed a higher tier of the diary. Fossegrimen will accept noted and un-noted versions of the raw fish and will inform you of how many pieces of fish you still need to give her in order to unlock the Infinite Lyre Teleport.

31 August 2017
(update)

Partially charged versions of the item could now be turned into bank placeholders.

23 June 2016
(update)
  • An "Equip" option was added.
  • The "Change-teleport" option was removed.
5 March 2015
(update | poll)
  • Fossegrimen will now give your enchanted lyre an extra charge when making a sacrifice if you have completed the Fremennik Easy Diary.
  • You can now change the Lyre teleport location to Waterbirth Island if you have completed the Fremennik Hard Diary.
  • You can now change the Lyre teleport location to Jatiszo or Neitiznot if you have completed the Fremennik Elite Diary.
1 August 2005
(update)

The charged version was renamed from "Enchanted lyre" to "Enchanted lyre(1)".

[[File:Enchanted lyre detail.png|left|130px]]
The '''enchanted lyre''' is acquired in [[The Fremennik Trials]] [[quest]]. It is used in the quest to perform in the longhall to get [[Olaf the Bard]]'s vote for the player to become a [[Fremennik]]. The [[lyre]] can be made by using an [[axe]] to cut a branch from the [[swaying tree]] east of [[Rellekka]], and then using a [[knife]] on the [[branch]] to obtain an [[unstrung lyre]], then attaching spun [[golden fleece]]. This part needs 25 [[Fletching]]. Alternatively, players may receive one as a drop from [[Lanzig]], [[Borrokar]] or [[Freidir]] in their huts in the south-eastern area of the village.
[[File:Lyre teleport.gif|thumb|200px|A player plays the lyre to teleport to the [[Fremennik Province]].]]
After the quest, the player can enchant their normal lyre into an enchanted lyre by charging it with [[Fossegrimen]] to be used as a [[teleport]] to [[Rellekka]]. When the [[hard Fremennik Diary]] is completed, the enchanted lyre can also teleport to [[Waterbirth Island]], and gains the ability to teleport to [[Jatizso]] and [[Neitiznot]] after completion of the [[elite Fremennik Diary]].

While equipped, the colour of the lyre's middle section is the same as the player's shoe colour.

==Combat styles==
{{CombatStyles|Unarmed}}

==Charging==
[[File:Enchanting lyre.gif|frame|A player has their lyre enchanted by Fossegrimen.]]
The lyre is enchanted by offering raw large [[fish]] to [[Fossegrimen]]'s altar south-west of Rellekka. Players may offer a [[raw shark]], [[raw manta ray]], or [[raw sea turtle]] to receive two, three, or four charges, respectively. If players equip a [[ring of charos (a)]], they can give Fossegrimen a [[raw bass]] and explain that it is really a small shark, and she will recharge the lyre with two charges. Upon expending the last charge, the lyre will revert to its unenchanted form. Players can '''only''' charge an unenchanted [[lyre]].

When the [[easy Fremennik Diary]] is completed, Fossegrimen will give an extra charge in addition to the offering given.

==Imbuing==
After completion of [[The Fremennik Trials]], players can imbue their lyre into an [[enchanted lyre(i)]], which contains infinite charges, by offering [[Fossegrimen]] a one-off offering of 1,000 [[raw shark]]s, [[raw bass]], [[Raw manta ray|raw manta rays]] and [[Raw sea turtle|raw sea turtles]], costing {{Coins|{{GEP|Raw shark|1000}}+{{GEP|Raw bass|1000}}+{{GEP|Raw manta ray|1000}}+{{GEP|Raw sea turtle|1000}}}}. Fossegrimen will accept both noted and un-noted offerings, and they can be given in increments; she will inform players of the remaining amount required to imbue the lyre.

The offering cost will drop by 200 raw fish of each type for each tier of the [[Fremennik Diary]] completed. However, she will not return any fish once a higher tier of the diary has been completed.

If lost, it can be re-obtained by going to the Fossegrimen and clicking "Summon" on the altar with a [[Lyre]] in inventory. Players do not have to pay the 1,000 of each fish cost if they have already paid it once before.

==Changes==
{{Subject changes header}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 30 May 2019
|update = Poll 67 Updates and Hosidius Improvements
|poll = Old School Content Poll 67: Small Old Content Changes
|change = After completing [[The Fremennik Trials]], you may now enchant your Lyre from [[Fossegrimen]] for permanent lyre teleports for 1,000 [[Raw Sea Turtle]]s, [[Raw Manta Ray]]s, [[Raw Shark]]s and [[Raw Bass]]. This drops by 200 for each [[Fremennik Diary|Fremennik diary]] completed, however, she will not return any fish once you've completed a higher tier of the diary. Fossegrimen will accept noted and un-noted versions of the raw fish and will inform you of how many pieces of fish you still need to give her in order to unlock the Infinite Lyre Teleport.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 31 August 2017
|update = Fossil Island Kudos Display, the Champion's Cape, and much more.
|change = Partially charged versions of the item could now be turned into bank placeholders.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 23 June 2016
|update = In Other News (23 June 2016)
|change = 
*An "Equip" option was added.
*The "Change-teleport" option was removed.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 5 March 2015
|update = Achievement Diaries
|poll = Old School Achievement Diary Rewards Poll
|change = 
*[[Fossegrimen]] will now give your enchanted lyre an extra charge when making a sacrifice if you have completed the [[Fremennik Easy Diary]].
*You can now change the Lyre teleport location to [[Waterbirth Island]] if you have completed the [[Fremennik Hard Diary]].
*You can now change the Lyre teleport location to [[Jatiszo]] or [[Neitiznot]] if you have completed the [[Fremennik Elite|Fremennik Elite Diary]].
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 1 August 2005
|update = Waterbirth Island
|change = The charged version was renamed from "Enchanted lyre" to "Enchanted lyre(1)".
}}
